name: keyboard
description: Keyboard actions for input, shortcuts, and browser control.

actions.name: press_key
actions.description: Press and release a single key (e.g. 'enter', 'esc', 'a'). This action simulates a simple key press.

actions.name: type_text
actions.description: Type a string of characters as keyboard input. The text is typed without delays between characters.

actions.name: hotkey
actions.description: Press a combination of keys simultaneously (e.g. ['ctrl', 'c']) to execute shortcuts like copy or paste.

actions.name: key_down
actions.description: Hold down a single key until released. This is useful for actions like highlighting text or using shortcuts.

actions.name: key_up
actions.description: Release a previously held key. It stops the action of holding the key down, like releasing the **Shift** key after selecting text.

actions.name: write_slow
actions.description: Type text one character at a time with a delay between keystrokes. Useful for simulating slow typing in automation.

actions.name: press_keys_sequence
actions.description: Press and release a sequence of keys one at a time in order (e.g. ['a', 'b', 'c']). Useful for automating multi-key inputs.

actions.name: copy_selected_text
actions.description: Press a combination of keys simultaneously (e.g. ['ctrl', 'c']) to execute shortcuts like copy or paste.

actions.name: paste_clipboard
actions.description: Paste clipboard contents (OS-detected shortcut). On macOS, this is `Cmd + V`, and on Windows, it’s `Ctrl + V`.

actions.name: refresh_browser
actions.description: Refresh the current browser tab (Cmd+R / Ctrl+R). It reloads the page or application.

actions.name: focus_address_bar
actions.description: Focus the address bar of the browser (Cmd+L / Ctrl+L). This action places the cursor in the browser’s URL field.

actions.name: new_tab
actions.description: Open a new browser tab (Cmd+T / Ctrl+T). It opens a new tab in your browser.

actions.name: close_tab
actions.description: Close the current browser tab (Cmd+W / Ctrl+W). This will close the active tab in the browser.

actions.name: navigate_back
actions.description: Navigate back to the previous page (Cmd+[ / Alt+Left). This simulates clicking the browser back button.

actions.name: navigate_forward
actions.description: Navigate forward to the next page (Cmd+] / Alt+Right). This simulates clicking the browser forward button.

actions.name: hold_and_press
actions.description: Hold one key down while pressing another key a specified number of times. Example: Hold **Cmd** and press **Tab** 8 times to switch apps.

actions.name: key_hold
actions.description: Hold down a single key (e.g., **Shift**) for a specified duration (in seconds). Useful for actions like selecting text.

actions.name: type_with_delay
actions.description: Type text one character at a time with a delay between keystrokes. Useful for simulating slow typing.

actions.name: open_spotlight
actions.description: Open Spotlight Search (Cmd+Space). It allows you to quickly search and launch apps or files on macOS.

actions.name: switch_apps
actions.description: Switch between applications (Cmd+Tab). This lets you cycle through your open apps.

actions.name: lock_screen
actions.description: Lock the screen (Cmd+Control+Q). This action will lock your macOS device.

actions.name: screenshot
actions.description: Take a screenshot (Cmd+Shift+4). This allows you to capture a portion of the screen as an image.

actions.name: minimize_window
actions.description: Minimize the current window (Cmd+M). This action will minimize the active window to the dock.

actions.name: quit_application
actions.description: Quit the current application (Cmd+Q). This will close the active application.
